page.title: 10Language
page.content: The Doric vocabulary is very rich and tailor made for the character and usage of the local people being full of minute detail for the farming process and rich in words of humour, wit and irony:- "Fit wye div ye nae come ootbye Keig files? It's a richt bonny bit plaicie wi gweed fairms an' a cwintryside that's a sight for sair een. The fowk will be fair pleased tae see ye in the kirk,shoppie or squeel an' ye'll get a gran welcome" TRANSLATION "Why don't you come out to Keig sometime? It's a very pretty little place with good farms and a countryside that's a sight to cure sore eyes. The people will be very pleased to see you in the church, shop or school and you'll get a grand welcome."
